intro: Fimbristylis ratnagirica, commonly known as the Ratnagiri sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and seasonally flooded areas. It has a fibrous root system and produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Fimbristylis ratnagirica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in parts of Asia.
